name: Come Hither
effect: The player learns to use the grappling hook in combat. Using an action, the player may throw the grappling hook at a target within 20 feet. Upon a successful {{skills.accuracy}} check against the targetâ€™s mitigation, the target is pulled 15 feet towards the player.

name: Defender
effect: The maximum DC penalty for wearing heavy armor is decreased by 2. The player no longer has disadvantage to mobility while wearing plate armor.

name: Parry
effect: The player may attempt to parry melee attacks using a reaction. When parrying, mitigation is increased by the parry amount of the weapon. Parrying an attack costs a reaction, regardless of whether the attack is successful.

name: Riposte
effect: The player may expend 2 willpower to follow up a successful parry with a counterattack. The attack roll must use dexterity as the base stat.

name: Feint Attack
effect: The player chooses a target and feigns an attack against it. The target's DC is reduced by 1d8 until the start of its next turn. If the target succeeds a dexterity saving throw equal to the attacker's dexterity score, their DC is only reduced by 1d4.

name: Hook Sword Disarm
effect: The player expends 1 willpower to make a special strike with the hook sword. The target must succeed a strength saving throw equal to the attacker's strength score or else their weapon is wrenched from their grasp.

name: Hook Sword Link Strike
effect: If the player is dual wielding hook swords, they may expend 2 willpower to make a two-handed attack. The damage die for the attack is increased to 1d10 and the attack range is increased to 10 feet.

name: Flailing Strike
effect: When making a weapon attack with a flail, the player may expend 1 willpower to ignore the bonus block chance provided by a shield. If the shield is actively blocking, its block chance is reduced by half instead.

name: Cleaving Strike
effect: Before making a slashing weapon attack, the player may spend 3 willpower to extend the weapon attack to an additional creature. The attacker makes separate attack rolls for both creatures; if both rolls are successful, the second attack does half damage. Both creatures must be within melee range.

name: Polearm Haft Strike
effect: The player may expend an action to follow up a polearm attack with a haft strike. The player makes a normal melee attack roll. haft strike deals 1d4 damage, and does not reduce dodge chance.

name: Shield Bash
effect: The player strikes directly with their shield. On a successful hit, the player deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage.

name: Estoc Master
effect: The player learns the proper use of the estoc, a martial thrusting sword. When attacking with the estoc, opponents wearing chain mail gain half BC from their armor.
reqs: At least one estoc sword in inventory

name: Mordhau
effect: The player learns the proper use of the mordhau technique, and can deal bludgeoning damage with mordhau weapons.
reqs: At least one sword in inventory with the mordhau property.

name: Lancer
effect: The player can use speed as the primary stat when attacking with polearms, and has advantage when making polearm attacks while mounted.

name: Keshik
effect: The player learns to manipulate and aim a bow and arrow from horseback. Range attacks while mounted no longer have disadvantage.
